questions.json.question: What is your favorite programming language and why?
Explain the difference between == and === in JavaScript
What are the four pillars of Object-Oriented Programming?
How would you implement a stack using two queues?
questions.json.hint: Think about how stack and queue operations differ

questions.json.question: What is the time complexity of binary search and why?
Explain the concept of closures in programming
questions.json.hint: Think about scope and function contexts

questions.json.question: What is the difference between SQL and NoSQL databases?
How does garbage collection work in programming languages?
What is Big O notation and why is it important?
Explain the difference between synchronous and asynchronous programming
What is the most challenging bug you have ever encountered?
How do you stay updated with the latest programming trends?
What is recursion and when would you use it?
Explain the MVC (Model-View-Controller) pattern
What are APIs and how do they work?
What is the difference between a compiler and an interpreter?
How would you optimize a slow-running SQL query?
questions.json.hint: Think about indexes, query structure, and execution plans

questions.json.question: What is the difference between HTTP and HTTPS?
Explain the concept of polymorphism in OOP
What are design patterns and name three common ones
How would you implement a LRU (Least Recently Used) cache?
questions.json.hint: Think about combining hash map with doubly linked list

questions.json.question: What is version control and why is it important?
Explain the difference between unit testing and integration testing
What is the CAP theorem in distributed systems?
How would you handle a situation where your code works on your machine but not in production?
What is the difference between machine learning and artificial intelligence?
Explain what happens when you type a URL in your browser and press Enter
What is the purpose of virtual environments in Python?
How do you ensure your code is secure?
What advice would you give to someone just starting their programming journey?

challenges.json.title: FizzBuzz Extended
challenges.json.description: Write a program that prints numbers from 1 to 100. For multiples of 3 print 'Fizz', for multiples of 5 print 'Buzz', for multiples of 7 print 'Bang', and for multiples of both print the combination (e.g., 'FizzBuzz', 'FizzBang', 'BuzzBang', 'FizzBuzzBang').
requirements: Print the number if none of the conditions apply
bonus_features: Make it configurable for different ranges

challenges.json.title: Smart To-Do List
challenges.json.description: Create a command-line to-do list application with advanced features like priority levels, due dates, categories, and search functionality.

challenges.json.title: URL Shortener Service
challenges.json.description: Build a URL shortener service similar to bit.ly with a web interface and API endpoints.
requirements: Shorten long URLs to unique short codes
Redirect short URLs to original URLs
Web interface for creating short URLs
bonus_features: User authentication and personal URL management

challenges.json.title: Expense Tracker
challenges.json.description: Create a personal expense tracking application with categories, budgets, and reporting features.

challenges.json.title: Code Snippet Manager
challenges.json.description: Build a tool for developers to store, organize, and quickly access their code snippets with syntax highlighting and search capabilities.
requirements: Store code snippets with title and description

challenges.json.title: Real-time Chat Application
challenges.json.description: Develop a real-time chat application with multiple rooms, user authentication, and message history.

challenges.json.title: Password Manager
challenges.json.description: Create a secure password manager with encryption, password generation, and browser integration.

challenges.json.title: API Rate Limiter
challenges.json.description: Implement a rate limiting system for APIs with different algorithms and storage backends.
bonus_features: Rate limit bypass for premium users

challenges.json.title: Mini Search Engine
challenges.json.description: Build a basic search engine that can crawl, index, and search through a collection of documents or web pages.

challenges.json.title: Game Leaderboard System
challenges.json.description: Design a scalable leaderboard system for games with real-time updates, multiple ranking types, and anti-cheat measures.

quotes.json: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. - Steve Jobs
Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out. - Chris Pine
Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it's bad. - Cory House
The best way to predict the future is to invent it. - Alan Kay
Simplicity is the soul of efficiency. - Austin Freeman
In programming, the hard part isn't solving problems, but deciding what problems to solve. - Paul Graham
First, solve the problem. Then, write the code. - John Johnson
Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes. - Oscar Wilde
Talk is cheap. Show me the code. - Linus Torvalds
Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand. - Martin Fowler
Programming is not about typing, it's about thinking. - Rich Hickey
The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user. - C.A.R. Hoare
Debugging is twice as hard as writing the code in the first place. - Brian Kernighan
Make it work, make it right, make it fast. - Kent Beck
Premature optimization is the root of all evil. - Donald Knuth
Code never lies, comments sometimes do. - Ron Jeffries
Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute. - Harold Abelson
The best error message is the one that never shows up. - Thomas Fuchs
It's not a bug ‚Äì it's an undocumented feature. - Anonymous
Programming is the art of algorithm design and the craft of debugging errant code. - Ellen Ullman
Learning to write programs stretches your mind, and helps you think better. - Bill Gates
Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it. - Patrick McKenzie
The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple. - Grady Booch
Software is a great combination between artistry and engineering. - Bill Gates
Clean code always looks like it was written by someone who cares. - Robert C. Martin
Code is read much more often than it is written. - Guido van Rossum
The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it. - Dennis Ritchie
Simplicity is prerequisite for reliability. - Edsger W. Dijkstra
Good code is its own best documentation. - Steve McConnell
Programming is not a science. Programming is a craft. - Richard Stallman
Don't comment bad code‚Äîrewrite it. - Brian Kernighan
Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight. - Bill Gates
Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live. - Martin Golding
There are only two hard things in Computer Science: cache invalidation and naming things. - Phil Karlton
Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen. - Edward V Berard
Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the Universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. - Rick Cook
The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before. - Bill Gates
The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit. - Anonymous
If debugging is the process of removing software bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in. - Edsger Dijkstra
Programming is like sex. One mistake and you have to support it for the rest of your life. - Michael Sinz
It's not that I'm so smart, it's just that I stay with problems longer. - Albert Einstein
Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts. - Winston Churchill
The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing. - Walt Disney
Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower. - Steve Jobs
Your limitation‚Äîit's only your imagination.
Push yourself, because no one else is going to do it for you.
Great things never come from comfort zones.
Dream it. Wish it. Do it.
Don't stop when you're tired. Stop when you're done.
Wake up with determination. Go to bed with satisfaction.

python.code:
squares = [x**2 for x in range(10)]
print(squares)  # [0, 1, 4, 9, 16, 25, 36, 49, 64, 81]
python.explanation: List comprehensions provide a concise way to create lists based on existing iterables.

python.code:
word_lengths = {word: len(word) for word in ['python', 'code', 'bot']}
print(word_lengths)  # {'python': 6, 'code': 4, 'bot': 3}
python.explanation: Dictionary comprehensions create dictionaries in a single line of code.

python.code:
with open('file.txt', 'r') as f:
    content = f.read()
    # File automatically closed
python.explanation: Context managers ensure proper resource cleanup, especially useful for file operations.
Enumerate provides both index and value when iterating over sequences.

python.code:
numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
squared = list(map(lambda x: x**2, numbers))
print(squared)  # [1, 4, 9, 16, 25]
python.explanation: Lambda functions are anonymous functions useful for short, simple operations.

javascript.explanation: Destructuring allows unpacking values from arrays into distinct variables.

javascript.code:
const {name, age} = {name: 'John', age: 25, city: 'NYC'};
console.log(name, age); // John 25
javascript.explanation: Object destructuring extracts properties from objects into variables.
Arrow functions provide a shorter syntax for writing functions.
Template literals allow embedded expressions and multi-line strings.
Async/await provides a cleaner way to handle asynchronous operations.

java.explanation: Java Streams provide functional-style operations on collections.
Optional helps avoid NullPointerExceptions by wrapping potentially null values.

react.explanation: useState is a Hook that lets you add state to functional components.
useEffect lets you perform side effects in functional components.
